intro: Knautia drymeja subsp. drymeja, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
